_source.text: 10 years of a wonderful, loving family life with a dad that loved and wanted you is a lot better than a lifetime of wondering why your father couldn't be bothered to give you the time of day.

text: **than** a lifetime of wondering why your father couldn't be bothered to give you **the** **time** of day.
10 years of a wonderful, loving **family** life with a dad that loved and wanted you is a lot **better**

_source.text: 2012 kicked my ass...i almost prayed that the mayans got it right...i sincerely hope that 2013 is better...going into the winter solstice yuletide season, i am not in a festive mood- as i suspect many aren't...i have been plagued by allergies that are aggravated by the weather change and haven't gotten better and my entire life has been turned upside down by my family...many stressors from many angles and i hope to start knocking some of them off this coming year...

gotten better and my entire life has been turned upside down by my **family**...many stressors from many
angles and i **hope** to start knocking some of them off this coming year...

_source.text: A die size that's larger, but its 50% off (zero power) when it's not needed is much better than a die size which is a bit smaller, faster, but burns more power all the time (Intel Atom and friends).

text: A die size that's larger, but its 50% off (**zero** power) when it's not needed is much **better** **than** a
die size which is a bit smaller, faster, but burns more power all **the** **time** (Intel Atom and friends).

_source.text: After considering the two options presented above and the negative aspects of each, you should be thinking "Wow, I hope there's something better than this, or else I'm packing up and going home!"

text: thinking "**Wow**, I **hope** there's something **better** **than** this, or else I'm packing up and going home!"

_source.text: ABC's current crop of single-camera shows does a good job of keeping the basic core of a multi-camera sitcom- The Middle is traditional, tumultuous family fare in the vein of  Everybody Loves Raymond ; Happy Endings could finally be the Friends clone that's better than Friends -while the NBC Thursday-night lineup and Raising Hope are so grounded in a love for the sitcoms of yore, they treat them as sacred texts.
